title: Celtics bench shines in bounce-back win over Magic: 7 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Celtics defeated the Magic 111-107, splitting their two-game series, with strong performances from their bench players.
Luka Garza scored 16 points with eight rebounds in 17 minutes, greatly contributing to the Celtics' victory.
Jordan Walsh showcased solid defensive skills, frustrating opponents and hitting a crucial 3-pointer near the game's end.

title: Jason Varitek is happy to be back with Red Sox on a new deal
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jason Varitek signed a new contract with the Boston Red Sox, remaining as the game-planning and run prevention coach.
Varitek has been with the Red Sox in various roles for nearly 30 years, joining Alex Cora’s coaching staff in 2021.
Catcher Carlos Narvaez impressed in his rookie season, batting .241 with 15 HR and 50 RBIs, and led MLB catchers with 32 CS.

title: Patriots’ explosive rookie class breaks through at perfect time in Tampa
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Kyle Williams and TreVeyon Henderson scored three touchdowns in the Patriots' 28-23 win over the Buccaneers.
Williams scored a 71-yard touchdown, while Henderson had two runs over 50 yards, including a game-winning 69-yard touchdown.
Rookie defensive players like Craig Woodson and Elijah Ponder contributed to New England's win with tackles and a crucial sack.

title: Oddsmakers have Drake Maye as NFL MVP favorite
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Drake Maye is the current NFL MVP frontrunner according to FanDuel, with odds at +250.
Maye threw for 270 yards and two touchdowns in the Patriots' 28-23 win over Tampa Bay.
Maye has a 71.7% completion rate, 2,555 passing yards, and 19 touchdowns this season.

title: Rob Gronkowski announces that he will ‘retire as a Patriot’
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Rob Gronkowski announced he will sign a one-day contract with the New England Patriots to retire with the team.
Gronkowski spent nine seasons with the Patriots and won three Super Bowls before playing two seasons with Tampa Bay.
The former tight end is regarded as one of the greatest, holding multiple records and accolades including four-time All-Pro.

title: Patriots stock watch: Here’s who stood out and struggled against the Buccaneers
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots rookies TreVeyon Henderson and Kyle Williams made key offensive contributions in a 28-23 victory over Tampa Bay.
New England's defense faced challenges containing Emeka Egbuka but managed crucial plays to secure their seventh consecutive win.
Tight ends Austin Hooper and Hunter Henry underperformed, with minimal impact in the passing game against the Buccaneers.

title: 10 takeaways from Patriots’ impressive road win over Buccaneers
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots extend win streak to seven with a 28-23 victory over the Buccaneers in Tampa.
Rookies TreVeyon Henderson and Kyle Williams accounted for three touchdowns, leading New England's offense.
Quarterback Drake Maye completed 16 of 31 passes for 270 yards, two touchdowns, and one interception.

title: MBTA Transit Police officer facing drunk driving charge after allegedly crashing into pole
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: MBTA Transit Police officer Jonathan Daveiga, 27, is charged with drunk driving after allegedly crashing into a pole in Boston.
Daveiga was arrested October 19 at Leverett Circle, failed multiple sobriety tests, and refused a breathalyzer test.
Daveiga is on modified duty and pleaded not guilty; his next court appearance is scheduled for December 19.

title: Allston Car Wash employees still in federal custody after ICE raid
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Nine Allston Car Wash employees with work permits remain in federal custody after a Nov. 4 ICE raid.
ICE agents allegedly detained the workers without allowing them to retrieve documents, despite having work permits.
Federal and local officials, including Rep. Pressley, condemned the operation, calling it unfair and cruel.

title: ‘SNL’ recap: Best moments from Nikki Glaser hosting ‘Saturday Night Live’
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Comedian Nikki Glaser hosted the Nov. 8 episode of 'Saturday Night Live' with musical guest Sombr.
Glaser's comedic rise began with a notable performance at the Tom Brady roast, leading to more high-profile gigs.
Highlights included Glaser's monologue, Sombr's performances, and Pete Davidson on the 'Weekend Update' desk.
